content.question:
The manager of the cafeteria at a local high school wanted to see if there was an association between a student’s grade level and whether the student approves of the food choices in the cafeteria. The manager selected a random sample of students and asked if they approved of the food choices and also recorded the grade levels of the students. If a student was in ninth or tenth grade, he or she was labeled as an underclassman, and if the student was in eleventh or twelfth grade, he or she was labeled as an upperclassman. The table shows the results of the survey.

Underclassman 

Upperclassman 

Total 

Approves of the Cafeteria Food 
50 
20 
70 

Does Not Approve of the Cafeteria Food 
30 
60 
90 

Total 
80 
80 
160 

Assuming that all conditions for inference have been met, which of the following equations gives the appropriate chi-square test statistic and the correct number of degrees of freedom to determine if there is an association between grade level and whether a student approves of the food choices in the cafeteria?

choices.label: <math alttext="chi square equals the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 50 minus 40, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 40, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 20 minus 40, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 40, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 30 minus 40, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 40, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 60 minus 40, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 40" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>χ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>50</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>40</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>20</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>40</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>30</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>40</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>60</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>40</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> with 4 degrees of freedom

<math alttext="chi square equals the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis 50 minus 35, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 50, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 20 minus 35, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 20, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 30 minus 45, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 30, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 60 minus 45, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 60" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>χ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>50</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>35</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>20</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>35</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>20</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>30</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>45</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>30</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>60</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>45</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>60</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> with 4 degrees of freedom

<math alttext="chi square equals the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 50 minus 35, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 35, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 20 minus 35, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 35, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 30 minus 45, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 45, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 60 minus 45, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 45" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>χ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>50</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>35</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>35</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>20</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>35</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>35</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>30</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>45</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>45</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>60</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>45</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>45</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> with 4 degrees of freedom

<math alttext="chi square equals the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 50 minus 40, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 40, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 20 minus 40, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 40, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 30 minus 40, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 40, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 60 minus 40, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 40" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>χ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>50</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>40</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>20</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>40</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>30</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>40</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>60</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>40</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> with 1 degree of freedom

<math alttext="chi square equals the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 50 minus 35, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 35, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis 20 minus 35, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 35, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 30 minus 45, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 45, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 60 minus 45, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 45" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>χ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>50</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>35</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>35</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>20</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>35</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>35</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>30</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>45</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>45</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>60</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>45</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>45</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> with 1 degree of freedom

content.answer: <math alttext="chi square equals the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 50 minus 35, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 35, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis 20 minus 35, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 35, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 30 minus 45, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 45, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, 60 minus 45, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 45" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>χ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>50</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>35</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>35</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>20</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>35</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>35</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>30</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>45</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>45</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>60</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>45</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>45</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> with 1 degree of freedom

topic.text: 8.6: Carrying Out a Chi-Square Test for Homogeneity or Independence

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Calculate a test statistic and find a p-value, provided conditions for inference are met.
